title: 105_hr1659
content: The Act is titled the "Mount St. Helens National Volcanic Monument Completion Act" and its purpose is outlined in the findings section. The Act entitled "An Act to designate the Mount St. Helens National Volcanic Monument" required the acquisition of all land and interests in the monument, including surface and mineral rights. While the surface interests exchange was completed on time, the exchange of mineral and geothermal interests remains unfinished. The purpose of this Act is to facilitate the completion of these exchanges. The Act aims to expedite the acquisition of private mineral and geothermal interests within the Mount St. Helens National Volcanic Monument. The Act expedites the acquisition of mineral and geothermal interests within Mount St. Helens National Volcanic Monument. The Act expedites the acquisition of mineral and geothermal interests within Mount St. Helens National Volcanic Monument by requiring the Secretary of the Interior to acquire these interests from certain companies within 60 days of enactment. The Secretary of the Interior must acquire interests from certain companies and issue monetary credits worth $2,100,000 to each company. These credits can be used for up to 50% of payments in mineral lease sales in the contiguous 48 states and up to 10% in Alaska. The Secretary of the Interior issues monetary credits worth $2,100,000 to companies for acquiring interests, which can be used for up to 50% of payments in mineral lease sales in the contiguous 48 states and up to 10% in Alaska. The Secretary of the Interior accepts credits issued for payments in the same manner as cash, subject to relevant laws. Credits accepted will be considered money received for specific purposes under relevant acts. An exchange account will be established within 30 days after completion of certain actions. The Secretary of the Interior will establish an exchange account for a company within 30 days of completing the required exchange, with an initial balance of $2,100,000 in credits. These credits can be used for specified purposes and adjusted based on credits accepted by the Secretary. Companies are authorized to transfer or sell credits. A company can transfer or sell credits to another person, who must be qualified to bid on mineral, oil, or gas leases. The company must notify the Secretary of the Interior within 30 days of any credit transfer or sale. The Secretary of the Interior must be notified of any credit transfer or sale within 30 days. After 5 years, unused credits in a company's account will become unusable. Title to mineral and geothermal interests acquired by the Secretary of the Interior will be transferred to the company upon the establishment of an exchange account. Within 180 days of enactment, the Secretary of the Interior must report to the House and Senate committees on remaining privately held mineral interests in the Monument and propose a plan for their acquisition.
